acidity.notes: Pungent, but not overwhelming fruit notes. Slight tang accumulates under tongue.

sweetness.notes: Not quite enough sweetness for jewel tones, but close. Complexity sits somewhere between creamy and flat. Has a grassy 'off' taste like overextracted green tea.

body.notes: Light syrup. Slightly creamy texture. Thickens to almost soupy as it cools.

finish.notes: Dark in mouth, tea notes, a bit of that grassy 'off' taste from overextracted green tea sits under tongue. A little astringency.

flavor: Smooth, mellow cup â€” sweetness and acidity are almost balanced. Fruit isn't harsh but not quite glowing. Complexity is okay, but there's a distinct grassy 'off' taste like overextracted green tea. This taste dominates the finish as well. Body thickens as cools while flavors diminish except for a little bitterness/tang.
notes: 8 second swirl bloom with 97g water. Drawdown was relatively consistent but slower than drawdowns with grind 23. Coarser grinds and longer times seem to correlate to smoother, less astringent, les volatile cups with higher body, but with less complexity/excitement overall.
